verb.description: Flatten by pressure; squeeze or press.
examples: the skirt can be folded and compressed into a small bag

noun.description: A pad of absorbent material pressed onto part of the body to relieve inflammation or stop bleeding.

origin: Late Middle English: from Old French compresser or late Latin compressare, frequentative of Latin comprimere, from com- together + premere to press; or directly from compress- pressed together, from the verb comprimere.
